intro: Aegiphila minasensis, commonly known as the Minasensis Aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of purple or pink flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
